text: Hello everyone! When trying to deploy our react project and theme for the first time we're getting an error because it can't find any module or partial. We're using typescript, when testing it with "jsx" files it works well, so it has to do with the way we're using typescript here. Has anyone ran into this issue before? Thanks :pray::pray:

I know you said it has to do with Typescript, but I am wondering if that is perhaps an additional wrinkle in a problem we saw: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1719434954126079?thread_ts=1719434863.201469&cid=C04AY1H2204|https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1719434954126079?thread_ts=1719434863.201469&cid=C04AY1H2204>

Our solution was to duplicate the components we wanted to use in both an Island setting and in a normal setting.

If this is the problem, then something about Typescript transpilation seems to be mucking up things during import.
In the example above, we needed to have both C and C2 which was just a duplicate that was only used if it was ultimately rendered in an island.
Hello <@U045GJFQQ20> - what path are you using to to point to your module or partial?
Also, what is the directory structure of your react project?
What do people usually use for serverless functions without HubSpot enterprise? Amazon AWS?

That's a very good question, and I'm curious about what solutions we actually have. For example, in the case above, the client will not upgrade to Enterprise only for one serverless function. The fix in this case will be for them to provide API endpoints without authorisation.
In another case, we built an entire middleware in Laravel
AWS Lambda would be my recommendation.
Interesting, I'll need to research that
maybe now that CMS React exists, HubSpot will offer serverless functions as an add-on eventually
